docs.title: marimo in mkdocs
docs.text: This is a mkdocs plugin that allows you to write marimo code fences in your markdown files. Create interactive documentation with ease!

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
data = {'a': [1, 2, 3], 'b': [4, 5, 6]}

And now we can display it as a table:

docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
Add mkdocs-marimo to your pyproject.toml or requirements.txt file or simply install it using pip or pixi. The plugin will automatically install the minimally required version of mkdocs it is compatible with.

pip install mkdocs-marimo
# or
pixi add mkdocs-marimo

docs.title: Quick Start
docs.text: After you installed the plugin, you can write marimo code fences in your markdown files.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
```marimo
import marimo as mo
data = {'a': [1, 2, 3], 'b': [4, 5, 6]}
mo.ui.table(data, selection=None)
```

This would produce an interactive table in your MkDocs documentation, powered by marimo.
